location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

physicalDescription.extent: Dimensions:71 x 95 mm [landscape]Condition:The image is in good condition.Foliation:'a'; '9'Process:Silver gelatin print

mods.abstract: Genre/Subject Matter:This image shows Muscat from the Mathra road, west or southwest of the town.In the background, at left, the towers of Al-Mirani fort rise in front of the sea beyond.Rocky outcrops rise from centre foreground and background to right of the image, while at centre the whitewashed buildings of the town can be seen.A whitewashed building, perhaps a small mosque, can be seen behind some palm trees in the middle-ground to the left. Several poles, visible at left and centre of the image may be telegraph poles.Inscriptions:Lower left, below image, in pen: ‘Muscat.’Upper left, above image, in pencil, crossed-out: ‘a’Lower right, alongside image, in pencil: ‘9’Lower right, below image, in pen: ‘from Mathra Road. (Jan. 1918)’
